EmailTemplate.name: Waltham Forest 2014 NCS Grads - RC events invite
EmailTemplate.subject: Invitation to community events with The Challenge Society - Reaching Communities this weekend!
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Dear {!Contact.FirstName},
Have you heard? Three teams of dedicated NCS Graduates have designed three Reaching Communities events for you to enjoy around Waltham Forest this Saturday, 31st January.
All the events are FREE and open to the public, and you're welcome to drop in on whichever you like during the day. See the details below...
- Team 1: The Divergents are running a homelessness awareness and fundraiser, featuring bands, speakers, food and games!
Time: 12pm - 4pm
Place: Pastures Youth Centre, 15 Davies Lane, Leytonstone, E11 3DR
- Team 2: The Boost are running a gig afternoon and community spirit raiser, featuring great local bands and get-to-know-each-other fun! Time: 3pm - 6pm
Place: Luna Lounge, 7 Church Lane, Leytonstone, E11 1HG
- Team 3: No Longer Silent are running an awareness raiser for sexual harassment and women's welfare, featuring bands, speakers and a prize draw!
Time: 2.30pm - 5.30pm
Place: Woodford Green United Reformed Church, 4 High Elms, Woodford Green, IG8 0UP
Come along, reunite with your friends from NCS, and get involved!
Next time it could be you!
The next wave of Reaching Communities projects will be starting up in the next couple of weeks, so why not get involved yourself?
A launch event for the next programme will be taking place during half term on Thursday 19th February, 1.45pm - 5pm at Pastures Youth Centre, 15 Davies Lane, Leytonstone, E11 3DR. To secure your FREE ticket to the event, click on the following link and register: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/reaching-communities-spring-2015-launch-tickets-14577538811.
Stay in touch with your mates from NCS!
Build your skills and expertise in running a project!
Get Â£400 to make an impact in your community!
There'll be free treats, fun, games and the chance to meet your new team and think about making a difference in your community. Call 07785 623339 for more information.
See you there!
Sam
